newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: S.Korean president's son arrested.
newsitem.headline: S.Korean president's son arrested.

text.p: South Korean President Kim Young-sam's son, Kim Hyun-chul, was arrested on Saturday, live television pictures showed.

The younger Kim, looking grim-faced and tired, was led out of the Supreme Public Prosecutors' Office in Seoul by prosecution officials and hustled into a waiting car to be taken to the Seoul Detention House.

A prosecution official said the arrest took effect as soon as he left the building at around 7.30 p.m. (1030 GMT). A crowd of news reporters jostled him as he emerged and chased his grey vehicle as it sped away.
Kim Hyun-chul was arrested on charges of accepting bribes of 3.2 billion won ($3.6 million) in return for favours and of evading taxes.
He was summoned by prosecutors on Thursday evening. Although he confessed to taking money during marathon interrogation sessions he insisted the cash did not represent kickbacks.
